feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Integration Suite
feed.subtitle: SAP Integration Suite Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Handling inventory updates from EWM to S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition in 7L1 integration scenario
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I’m working on an integration between SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and SAP EWM on Private Cloud, using the 7L1 scope item and communication scenario SAP_COM_0A58.

The standard delivery-based processes (inbound, outbound, stock transport orders) are working fine. However, we’re facing challenges with warehouse-driven updates that need to be reflected back in ERP.

Examples of limitations we’re encountering:

  • Pick Denial
    When picking in EWM is partially denied, the reduced quantity is not reflected in the outbound delivery in ERP. This can cause inconsistencies in fulfillment and invoicing.

  • Physical Inventory Differences
    When a cycle count is processed and differences are posted in EWM, the updated stock quantity is not synchronized back to ERP. The ERP stock remains unchanged.

  • Ready for Shipping status
    When the goods are packed or staged in EWM, the “Ready for Shipping” status is not updated in the ERP delivery.

According to SAP Note 3629180:

SAP clearly states these processes are not supported in the standard 7L1 integration.

I’ve come across several discussions and documents suggesting that these types of updates could be solved via custom SAP Cloud Integration (CPI) flows for example, by pushing events from EWM and updating ERP via exposed APIs.

My question:

  • Is CPI indeed the recommended workaround for synchronizing EWM status and inventory changes to ERP in this scenario?

  • Are there any best practices, alternative approaches, or roadmap items to cover these types of back-synchronizations?

  • How are other customers or partners solving this in mixed EWM decentralized + S/4HANA Public Cloud environments?

Any guidance or insights would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Error in calling Outbound Delivery public API in iflow in integration suite
entry.content:
I have created a simple iflow where odata public API API_OUTBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV;v=0002 is called in odata v2 receiver adapter to fetch Outbound delivery details from SAP S4 HANA public cloud system. I am able to get Outbound Delivery number using GET call. Now, to fetch item details, in resource path, i selected sub level as 1 and then selected item number field in 'to_DeliveryDocumentItem' sub-level.
Below is the query that is getting generated
$select=DeliveryDocument,to_DeliveryDocumentItem/DeliveryDocument,to_DeliveryDocumentItem/DeliveryDocumentItem&$expand=to_DeliveryDocumentItem&$filter=DeliveryDocument eq '80000000'

No payload is passed to this iflow.

I am getting below error when iflow is triggered through postman
com.sap.it.rt.adapter.http.api.exception.HttpResponseException: An internal server error occured: An exception of type 'WstxUnexpectedCharException' occurred.. cause:com.ctc.wstx.exc.WstxUnexpectedCharException: Unexpected character '&' (code 38) (expected a name start character) at [row, col{unknown source}]: [1,182].  The MPL ID for the failed message is : AGiSChZ7DkZ-t0vCX2lUJ7YK8I9d

Kindly help in resolving this issue

entry.title: Integration Suite and Connection Type G for synchronous BAPIs?
entry.content:
I have an ALE scenario where BAPIs are called both synchronously (reading data) and asynchronously (posting). I would like to use the Integration Suite (CPI) to establish a connection between the two systems. The iFlows would be a simple passthrough. This is possible for the asynchronous case where IDocs are simply forwarded. Is this also possible for synchronous BAPIs? How would an iFlow look like?

I've tried calling a synchronous BAPI with a destination of Type G in SE37 but SE37 does not support Type G Connections. Is Type G supported for synchronous BAPIs in general?

entry.title: Manual Export/Import vs Cloud Transport Management Service to transport BTP projects
entry.content:
Hi experts, 

I'm confusing which method is better between manual export/import and Cloud Transport Management Service to transport BTP projects like Build Process Automation approval workflows, Business Application Studio ui5 apps and Integration Suite iflows.

I checked some blogs and it is recommended to use Cloud Transport Management Service instead manual export/import.

By using Cloud Transport Management Service, there are advantages like Manual effort (no need to reconfigure everything), Less error-prone and so on.

So, I tried to transport one of my BPA approval process by using both methods.

And the results are same.

I needed to reconfigure the same steps for both methods.

There is no difference between them and using cTMS is more complex for me because there is initial set up and additional cost too.

 

So, could you please explain details why and when cTMS should be used, in details?

 

Thank You.

Aye Chan

entry.title: SAP CPI: Test Groovy Locally
entry.content:
SCPIScriptTest is a lightweight Java library that enables you to develop and test SAP CPI Groovy scripts locally, outside of the SAP Integration Suite environment. It simulates the runtime context and supports headers, properties, attachments and value mapping.

GitHub Link of SCPIScriptTest 

🚀 Features

  • Execute and test Groovy scripts locally without deploying to SAP CPI.
  • Simulate message bodies, headers, properties, and attachments.
  • Load value mappings from a .zip file.

📦 How to Use

1. Add the Library to Your Project

Include SCPIScriptTest.jar in your project's classpath.

2. Example Code

import com.sap.cpi.test.RunScript;
import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;

public class MainClass {

    public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {

        // Path to the message file (used as input body)
        String messagePath = "./testFile.json";

        // Path to the Groovy script to be tested
        String scriptPath = "./src/com/test/TestScript.groovy";

        // Initialize the script runner
        RunScript runScript = new RunScript(messagePath, scriptPath);

        // Load value mappings if needed
        runScript.loadValuemapping("/VM.zip");

        // Retrieve the message object before executing
        Message message = runScript.getMessage();

        // Set message headers
        message.setHeader("partnerName", "PARTNER1");
        message.setHeader("IDOCType", "MBGMCR");

        // Set exchange properties
        message.setProperty("sourceAgency", "Sender");
        message.setProperty("sourceIdentifier", "CUSTNUM");
        message.setProperty("sourceValue", "VAL");
        message.setProperty("abc", "1234");

        // Execute the script method (default is "processData")
        message = runScript.invokeMethod("processData");

        // Print the transformed message to console
        System.out.println("Transformed message:");
        System.out.println(message.getBody());

        // Optionally write the output to a file
        /*
        FileOutputStream out = new FileOutputStream(messagePath + ".out");
        out.write(message.getBody(String.class).getBytes());
        out.close();
        */
    }
}

🛠 Requirements

  • Java 8 or later
  • Your Groovy script should conform to the CPI message interface (use Message class)

📁 Sample File Structure

your-project/
│
├── SCPIScriptTest.jar
├── testFile.json
├── VM.zip
└── src/
    └── com/
        └── test/
            └── TestScript.groovy

📄 License

Not licensed and open to use. Suggestions & feedback welcome. 😍

entry.title: Calling SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud APIs from SAP Integration Suite with OAuth 2.0
entry.content:
Hi all,

I can connect from SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration) to S/4HANA Public Cloud APIs using Basic Authentication, but I’d like to switch to OAuth 2.0 for better security.

When I try to set up a communication system/arrangement, the only inbound OAuth option I see is OAuth 2.0 (Public Client, PKCE). I don’t see OAuth 2.0 Identity Provider (which I would normally expect for certificate-based SAML Bearer Assertion).

So far:

  • Basic Auth works fine.

  • I created a key pair in CPI keystore and uploaded the cert to S/4, but inbound OAuth user creation still only shows PKCE.

  • Customers are asking for a more secure approach than Basic Auth.

My questions:

  1. Is OAuth2 SAML Bearer Assertion officially supported for inbound calls to S/4HANA Public Cloud from Integration Suite?

  2. If so, how do I enable the Identity Provider option in inbound communication users? Is it tenant-specific?

  3. If not, what is the best practice today for securing these integrations beyond Basic Auth?

Thanks in advance for clarifications or official references.

entry.title: TAB Delimited in Message Transformation bean in BTP IS

I am doing StructXML2Plain for XML to CSV conversion using MessageTransformationBean groovy. Requirement is to use tab(\t) delimiter.

Unable to get the tab delimited file in the end. File shows Output values with \t instead of actual tab delimited. I have used below combinations - \t  ,  '\t'  , '0x09'  , 0x09 . Nothing works.

Is this the limitation of MTB Groovy or if anyone has done this please suggest

Thanks
Mohit

entry.title: Using SAP CPI to Perform POST Calls on SAP Datasphere OData API
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

In my current scenario, I need to perform both GET and POST operations on an OData API exposed from SAP Datasphere. Querying records works fine using OAuth 2.0 with the Authorization Code grant type.

Now, I have another use case where I need to push data from SAP CPI into Datasphere for integration purposes. While I know that data loading can be done using the JDBC adapter in CPI, I would prefer an API-based approach.

The key challenge I’m facing is around executing a POST request to insert records directly into Datasphere tables. Does Datasphere support inserting data into its tables via APIs, or is there a workaround required to achieve this?

If anyone has implemented this in a project, I would really appreciate your insights.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: DCPPUSHSERVICE to create DP document from the XML received by SAP DRC via PEPPOL network
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are in the process of setting up the E-invoicing solution for Belgium, which involves configuring the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) connection for our enterprise. This setup will enable us to receive supplier invoices via the PEPPOL network as mandated for B2B transactions.

To clarify the flow: Supplier >>> PEPPOL network >>> SAP DRC >>> SAP ECC

We have reviewed the relevant SAP notes regarding the integration of PEPPOL data into SAP ECC. These notes mention the use of the DCPPUSHSERVICE for sending received data. We seek clarification and support on the correct configuration and any prerequisites or known issues related to setting up this service within the SAP DRC framework.

We are encountering an error related to the DCPPUSHSERVICE in the Belgium e-invoicing project. Specifically, the error states that there is no BAdI implementation found for the interface connector, impacting the processing of incoming Peppol invoices.

The relevant BAdI in question is DCS_INTERFACE_CONNECTOR. We attempted to implement a custom solution using the implementation name ZTXS_DCS_INTF_CONNECTOR, but the issue persists and prevents proper e-invoice processing.

We request support assistance to investigate and resolve the missing or misconfigured BAdI implementation error for this service to ensure compliance and uninterrupted invoice processing in the Belgium DRC setup.

Please advise on the next steps or provide guidance on troubleshooting if we encounter any issues during the setup.

entry.title: Is it possible make a CAP Application consume events from EMIS (Integration Suite Event Mesh) ?
entry.content:
Hi CAP community.

I am trying to leverage EMIS (Integration Suite's Event Mesh capability) within a CAP v9 Application. I am following this great video of @ajmaradiaga along side with CAP's documentation (which is not specific to EMIS, but to Standalone Event Mesh service). 

I have successfully set up a queue + topic subscription in EMIS which is receiving events from S/4HANA Public Cloud. I created a service instance of SAP Integration Suite, Event Mesh (message-client plan) to provide the credentials to the CAP application (and S4), and bound it both in .cdsrc and mta to feed them at runtime. This is working.

So far so good,  but here is the twist: the bound credentials of the EMIS service don't contain the 'management' object that CAP's messaging service implementation is expecting. See the below error, which is what I am hitting after starting the cap server using

"kind": enterprise-messaging  (or -shared)

options.credentials is correctly bound to EMIS client service key, but no management object exist

I know that when you create an instance of the Standalone SAP Event Mesh service, the keys contain this management object, as stated in the 'documentation'. However, the binding to the EMIS Message Client doesn't:

This makes me wonder: is CAP prepared to integrate with Integration Suite's Event Mesh, or not yet? (CAP documentation doesn't mention this specific use case).

Is there something wrong within my set up?

 

Any help or clue is well appreciated!

Lucho

entry.title: I can't create an API provider (cloud connector)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community.

When I try to create an API provider with Cloud connector option I give details about Management Host, Authentication Basic and use my GmailID and password of my sap trial account, it throws me this exception: System is up and reachable. However, the ping check responded with code: 401; Message: Unauthorized.

I have logged into my account with the same GmailID and password, and when i go to manage profile and try to change the password by giving my current password it throws an exception saying: Could not be verified. 

Note: The password works when I log into my trial account.

Any help is much appreciated.
